objtitle.title: The Virgin and Child in Egypt

objdescid.compdate: 1810Butlin 669 reports that the work is signed and dated "Fresco by Will^m Blake 1810" on the tree trunk left of center. This inscription is not clearly evident in our reproduction.

objinfo.medium: water-based tempera with a glue and/or gum binder

provenance.name: Victoria and Albert Museum
provenance.note: Acquired from Blake by Thomas Butts; by inheritance to Thomas Butts, Jr., in 1845; sold from the collection of Thomas Butts, Jr., Foster and Son auction, London, 29 June 1853, lot 75 (10s. to William Stirling-Maxwell); Archibald Stirling, probably by inheritance in 1878; William Stirling of Keir, probably by inheritance in 1931; acquired by Paul Mellon in 1953; given by Mellon to the Victoria and Albert Museum in 1953.

desc.objtitle:
The Virgin and Child in Egypt,
Object 1 (Butlin 669)

objnote.p: *The Virgin and Child in Egypt* is based on Matthew 2:14-15. The painting is part of a series of four works also including *Adam Naming the Beasts* (Butlin 667), *Eve Naming the Birds* (Butlin 668), and *Christ Blessing* (Butlin 670).
